comment: The closure of an open ball in a metric space is contained in the corresponding closed ball. (Equality need not hold; for example, with the discrete metric, the closed ball of radius 1 is the whole space, but the open ball of radius 1 is just a point, whose closure is also a point.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Dec-2013.)
